lines.text: The misery, the exquisite tragedy. The Susan Hayward of it all. I can just picture you there, sitting alone at your table in your lavender gown.
Did I tell you my gown was lavender?
'God, I should have stopped in all my evil plotting to have that manicure, but it's too late now.
George, I didn't tell you my dress was lavender.

sleek, stylish... radiant with charisma. Bizarrely, he's on the telephone. But then, so are you. And then he comes towards you... the moves of a jungle cat. Although you quite correctly sense that he is... gay... like most devastatingly handsome single men of his age are, you think... what the hell. Life goes on. Maybe there won't be marriage... maybe there won't be sex... but, by God, there'll be dancing.
Kimmy says if you love someone you say it, you say it right then, out loud. Otherwise, the moment just...
Passes you by.
Passes you by. Yeah.
I have a confession. Another confession. Besides that I - love you, this is even worse. The e-mail that Walter sent to your boss - I wrote that. I'm the bad guy.
Are you crazy? Jules, are you - are you completely insane? I mean - I mean - Jules, how could you do that?
Michael, it wasn't supposed to get sent. I just - I just wanted you to get mad at Kimmy.
[sighs]
God. I have done nothing but underhanded, despicable, not even terribly imaginative things since I got here.
[sighs]
But I was ju - Michael, I was just trying to - to win you, to win you back.
[Crying]
But that doesn't excuse any of it. I'm pond scum. Well, lower actually. I'm like the - the fungus that feeds on pond scum.
Lower. The pus that infects the mucous... that cruds up the fungus... that feeds on the pond scum. On the other hand, thank you... for loving me that much. That way, it's - it's pretty flattering.
Except it makes me fungus.
It's amazing the clarity that comes with psychotic jealousy.
Michael's chasing Kimmy?
Yes!
You're chasing Michael?
YES!
Who's chasing you... nobody, get it? There's your answer. It's Kimmy.
No. Crème brûlée can never be Jell-O. YOU could never be Jell-O.
I HAVE to be Jell-O!
You're never gonna be Jell-O! Now you need to come clean with your parents about this wedding because if you wait for the "Do you take this man?" part, it's considered poor form.

Michael, I love you. I've loved you for nine years. I've just been too arrogant and scared to realize it, and, well, now, I'm just scared, so - I-I-I realize this comes at a very inopportune time, but I really have this gigantic favor to ask of you. Choose me. M-marry me. Let me make you happy. Oh, that sounds like three favors, doesn't it? B-but...
You kissed him!
[Gasp]
At my parents' house!
That's cold.
On my wedding day!
Bitch.
Tramp.
Shut up! Now I love this man, and there is no way I'm gonna give him up to some two-faced, big-haired food critic.

I had the strangest dream. I dreamt that some psychopath was trying to break the two of you up. Luckily, I woke up and I see that the world is just as it should be. For my best friend has won the best woman. Um, I didn't buy you a gift. However, this is on loan until you two find your song. So...
He's got you on a pedestal and me in his arms.
This is my one chance at happiness. I have to be ruthless!
He just came in for few hours to uh, to uh, FUCK ME.
Huh! Takes a few hours.
He sucks soup through his front teeth.
That's a trademark move. Don't touch that one.
But he sure can kiss.
George, this is so sweet of you to come to our rehearsal. I insist you stay on to lunch.
Oh yes.
No, no, no, no, no... Absolutely...
Love to! Love the bag, love the shoes, love everything. Love to!
If he were feeling what I'm feeling then he would know how it feels.

[George is about to be introduced to Kimmy's family]
Oh my god, race you to the altar!

[under her breath]
Underplay.
Got it.
[to a relative]
HEY! I'm Jules' fiance, George! Just stopped by for a little preconjugal visit if you catch my drift!
What I mean, when I say annoyingly perfect, is that there is nothing annoying about her perfection. It's vulnerable and endearing... and that is annoying as shit.
Ahh... you like her...
If I didn't have to hate her, I'd adore her.
Now remember, it is the duty of the best man to dance with the maid of honor.
Dance? You can't dance. When did you learn how to dance?
I've got moves you've never seen.
Look, tell him you love him. Bite the bullet.
Listen, Jules. Why don't we stop and have a drink? You can take a later flight.

No, no, no, no. I'm a busy girl. I've got exactly four days to break up a wedding, steal the bride's fella and I haven't one clue how to do it. He was in love with everyday for nine godddamn years. Me!
You're going to humiliate me, aren't you?
Only if I can.
Bond, Jane Bond
It is not going well! This is what comes of telling the truth, or even part of it. You know, getting what you deserve is totally unfair.
Takes one woman in a billion to put up with his array of shit. The guy's a one-man walking festival of idiosyncra - well, you've been introduced to the symponic range...
Of his snoring? Yeah, he says it's worse than ever. You know that "snarfle" one?
Oh, yeah.
I think I'm going to cry.
Me too.
The ring.
[handing the box to Jules]

[nervous]
Why are you giving this to me?
Because I don't trust Scotty.
You guys ran out of here before the commotion happened!
Commotion?
Well! My sister was licking an ice sculpture and her tongue froze right to it.
And that's a commotion?
It's a sculpture of the DAVID!
When you kissed Michael, did he kiss you back?
What do you mean? We were lip to lip.
Go on. This is so moving. Kindred spirits, eh?
No, he's nothing like me. He's like you, actually, only straight.
Coffee anyone?
pointing to his dad And Julianne this guy you know.
kisses Joe on the cheek Papa Joe.
I told him he should make you his best man darling but had to go with his baby brother. ruffles his youngest son Scotty's head
